info.title: Users
info.description:
The Users API provides endpoints for user account management, including:
* Creating and managing user accounts, permission groups, and departments
* Updating user photos
* Assigning user roles & permissions
* Tracking and auditing platform access
* Allocating and managing user licensing
* Maintaining personal platform preferences

## Creating Users
User accounts are defined as one of the three types in the table below. Each of these  

### User Types & Licensing
These types of users are listed in the table below.

| User Type | Description | Typical Roles | Licensed User |
| - | - | - | - |
| `seat` | A licensed system user account with access to the Counterbalance Console | Building Engineer, Property Manager, Facilities Director, Energy Engineer | Yes |
| `user` | A licensed end-user account with access to the Counterbalance Portal | Building Tenant, Space Occupant | Yes |
| `record_user` | A _"placeholder"_ user account for a user that is tracked via Counterbalance but does not hold a license and cannot actively interact with the platform | *n/a* | No |

## Managing Users

get.description:
Retrieve a list of user accounts available to the authenticated user

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`user:*`,`user:account:*`,`user:account:list`
* Licensed Feature: `user_base`

### Variations
If the `status` query paramter is not included with the request, only active user accounts are returned. 

Query paramters are stacked. That is, if you specify a specific site and department, then only users that match BOTH of these parameters will be returned.

### Returned User Scope
This is a scoped endpoint and the data returned may not be a complete, conclusive listing of all resources in the tenant account.

Users with `*` & `user:*` permission scopes will always have access to the complete resource data set in the tenant.

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Return only the users assigned to the specified site ID

parameters.name: department
parameters.description: Return only the users assigned to the specified department ID

parameters.name: auth_only
parameters.description: Return only the users with active auth accounts

post.description:
### Synopsis
Create a new user and optionally assign a license and password

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`user:*`,`user:account:*`,`user:account:create`
* Licensed Feature: `user_base`
* If adding a license, adequate quota of the requested type

### Defining the User Type
The field `type` may be one of either: 

* `record_user` _(non-licensed user)_
* `seat` _(licensed system user)_ 
* `user` _(licensed end user)_

If type is defined as either `seat` or `user`, the new user will be sent a notification email informing them of their new account. _As of February 2021, there is a pending request to disable this feature via query paramater_

If the `type` field is omitted, the user will default to `record_user`

### Setting the User Password
The `password` field is required when the user type specified is either `seat` or `user`. In all other cases, it is ignored.

delete.description:
### Synopsis
Mark the specified user account for deletion

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`user:*`,`user:account:*`,`user:account:delete`

### Account Retention & Restoration

When deleted, an account is merely marked for deletion and any associated auth account is blocked. The user can be restored for up to 30 days after it is deleted using the Restore User Account endpoint. 

### Permanently Delete a User

To permanently delete a user account, pass the `permanent` query parameter and set it to true. The account will be immediately and permanently removed from the system and cannot be restored.

parameters.name: permanent
parameters.description: If true, the user will be permanently deleted and cannot be restored

The field `type` may be one of either: 

* `record_user` _(non-licensed user)_

<!-- theme: danger -->

### Setting the User Password
The body field `password` is required when the user type specified is either `seat` or `user`. In all other cases, it is ignored.

Upload a custom photo for the specified user

**Prerequisites** 

The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`user:*`,`user:account:*`,`user:account:update`
* Licensed Feature: `user_base`

**Photo Requirements**

The uploaded photo must meet the following criteria:

* `jpeg` or `png` format
* Square, equal dimensions
* Greater than 250px but less than 1000px

put.description:
### Synopsis
Reset the password for the specified user

<!-- theme: success -->
> _This endpoint accepts `self` in place of a UUID_

The target user will be notified via email that their password has changed. The new password will not be included in the email.

### Prerequisites
The following prerequisites are required for this endpoint:

#### When using a UUID:
* An active tenant account
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`user:*`,`user:account:*`,`user:account:update`

#### When using _self_:
* Permissions _(at least one):_ `*`,`user:*`,`user:self:*`,`user:self:password`

### Password Strength
Password strength is an important consideration when setting passwords for your users. Counterbalance enforces a strong password policy that has the following requirements:

* Must be at least 8-characters in length
* Lower case (a-z), upper case (A-Z) and numbers (0-9)
* Special characters (!@#$%^&*)
* No more than 2 identical characters in a row

NIST recommends a minimum character length of 8, and suggests that length is a better indicator of strength than complexity.

<!-- theme: warning -->
> #####  Heads Up
> 
> _A password will be rejected if it contains common dictionary phrases or the user's first name, last name, or shortname._

### Password History

A new password must be different than the user's last 3 passwords.
